title: Welcome Party
description: Andy tries to break up with his girlfriend after going to Florida to declare his love for Erin, and the office employees are forced against their will to throw a party for the hated Nellie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Jim. Stanley's back from the hospital today. Can you sign his card?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, great. [reads] "Glad they didn't mix up your tonsillectomy with a moustachectomy." Oh that's not good.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, because your jokes are all hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's nice. It's funny. It mentions his tonsillectomy and makes a funny little joke about his moustache.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley doesn't have a moustache.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah he does.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, hit the brakes. Stanley does not have a moustache. I misspoke. I'm not sure. I think he has one, now that- I think he has a moustache.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, Phyllis sits across from him every day. Phyllis, does he have a moustache or not?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I don't know. Now I think he doesn't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis! What are you talking- The whole card depends on this!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, the man's worked here for 25 years. How can none of us picture his face?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: 'Cause we come here to do our jobs. We don't stick our noses in other people's business.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, which one of these looks more right? [holds up drawing of Stanley with and without a moustache]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Neither of those looks like any person that has ever existed or been dreamt of in the history of human insanity. That said, the one on the left.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [bell dings] Guys, that's the elevator. What if it's him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, quick. Who says moustache? [Pam, Oscar, Dwight, and Creed raise their hands]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who says no moustache? [Jim, Angela, and Phyllis raise their hands; Gabe enters, hiding Stanley's face]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [reveals Stanley's moustache] Ah! Ha ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He does have a moustache.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Welcome back, Stanley. [Stanley grunts]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: "Good morning, Robert," says no one because our receptionist is in Florida. [no one responds] Pam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! [takes out earbuds]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Is this a video conference you're having with "Drake, featuring Swizz Beatz"?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, no, I was just, um, just having a cup of coffee, kind of warming up for the day.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: People, you should come to work already warm. Nine to ten a.m. is the most productive potential that a human being-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Sorry, sorry, everyone, I'm late! But you all are here, so no harm done at all by my lateness.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughing] Nellie, really, nine fifty?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, here's what happened. Seven forty-six, my alarm clock goes off. I hear it. Whack the snooze.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Nine minutes. Bzz! Off it goes again. Whack! Seven more times I did that. Bzz, whack. Bzz, whack! By the time I got up, it was ten minutes ago. No willpower. That is my curse!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughs] I've never believed willpower was very important in a woman.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ah ha!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I don't think you would have shown up to work nearly an hour late for no reason.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, I assure you, I would have done. I did, and I will keep doing it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. There's something going on. Some stress in your life.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, yes, uh... there is the whole moving to Scranton nonsense. Thirty boxes arrived yesterday from England and two trunks from Florida. Then I have to move in to my apartment in this dreadful, God knows where it is backwater suburb of a suburb, and I mean, no offense but are there a lot of Irish people living around here?

quotes.speaker: {Kevin} & {Meredith}
quotes.text: [in unison] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ugh! I hate that! No offense.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: None taken.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, Nellie, this monologue you're delivering is very offensive.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: oh! Ay, carumba! The natives are getting restless!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Who's a native?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Uh, excuse me, the tone here is getting quite hostile. I would appreciate it if you would keep that stuff on the basketball court. [everyone groans]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: If you'd let me finish- Or the squash court, or the Supreme Court. Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Nellie?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes, Robert!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You're clearly under a lot of... stress with the moving and the work situation you've found yourself in.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Let's help her out, shall we? Go above and beyond today to show her some of that warm Scranton hospitality. Jim. Dwight. Take the day. Help Nellie move those boxes into her new place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why Jim?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The rest of you, let's throw a party at the end of the day to welcome the newest member of our little community.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry, we're throwing a party for someone because they're being horrible?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, we're taking work time to move someone's personal belongings into their new apartment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm still not sure why this woman is even here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why is she here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings] Two crazy kids on the journey of life.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [sings] Going to Pennsylvania.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: On the road with my new girlfriend. But first, a small pit stop to break up with my current girlfriend who is at her parents' cabin in southern Pennsylvania.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. That must be nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. It's a beautiful place. Great place to let her down easy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, I meant that it must be nice to have parents.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings] Time to have a little kiss!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm. Sorry. Right. No kisses till the breakup is official.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I believe in that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes. So do I.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think that's important. That is important. Bummer, but important.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Important.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I can't believe he's making us throw a party for her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She's always late, she's always rude...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It kinda makes me want to throw a really bad party.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: On purpose.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [laughs] We should do it right here in the break room. [they giggle]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Order carrot cake. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...and Jessica, just so you know, this is way more about my love for Erin than anything wrong with you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, Andy, I'm upset, but you did this in the best way possible, and I knew you as a lover and I'll remember you as a gentleman. Okay, that was one minute and ten seconds.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Consider it nailed.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [vocalizing]  I think we should try again. This time, worst case scenario.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, here we go. Jessica, I'm really sorry. I just need you to know-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [whining] What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just need you to know-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What is it? I didn't sleep well last night. [they laugh]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lifting box] Ugh! Ow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nellie, that reminds me. Do you want this chair in the bedroom? 'Cause to be honest, I don't think it's gonna fit through the door.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't listen to Jim. Have you ever seen him play Tetris? "Oh, I think I'll just use this line horizontally. Oh, I had no idea what a gift this line is."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was one time-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will get the chair in. Watch the Great Schrutini work his magic.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, no. Really? Magic? No, no, no. Let's not go there. No, nothing is more repellant than magicians. Bunch of grown men waving wands, pulling bunnies out of body crevices. Magicians are repulsive. Next topic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [cell phone rings] Excuse me, one second. Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, nothing, just hauling some cube with Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shouting] Haulin' cube!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's moving boxes. We just came up with the term to make it sound cooler.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So we're planning this party for Nellie, and we're gonna make it really bad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds like every other party.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. We're gonna make it like a prank. Like order bad food, give her this passive-aggressive card.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Hire a magician.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Trust me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. There's a lot of cars here. This is just weird.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: [knocks on car window] Andy! Hey, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Lauren. Look at you.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Well, I know. Look at me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was just on my way back from this business trip, thought I'd stop and say hi to Jessica.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Aww! [clicks tongue]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why is Erin with me? That's a great question. She is my coworker, and she needed a ride because she totaled her car.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Oh. God.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So, I'm Erin. Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yep. This is Erin.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Nice to meet you. [Erin gasps at another girl outside her window] Well, Jess went out for a run but she'll be back soon. Hey ladies, Andy's here!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay Andy, that is a bachelorette party, this is Jessica's friends and they've been drinking during the daytime. Should we go?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Uh, you know, we had such a quick window to make this work, I think we should probably just-

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Oh, Jess! [claps] Look who stopped by after his business trip!

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Andy! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wonder if king-sized sheets are called presidential-sized in England. I really should have a Tweeter account.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, you should.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [finds shoe box] Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reads] "Nellie, don't open, stupid. Love, Nellie."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have to see these shoes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I doubt that they're sh-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa. Who is this guy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here's the two of them taking a hike. I'm guessing he's some kind of friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here's the two of them kissing at a beach and kissing at the Eiffel Tower. I'm guessing he's some kind of close romantic friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Like a boyfriend?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You read my mind.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Whoa. Here's one with his face whited out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm. Maybe someone threw a pie in his face. New theory- he's a hated Italian politician.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Better theory. This is her ex-boyfriend and they went through some kind of painful breakup.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [walks in] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Nellie. I'm so sorry. We were just...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I see you've discovered Benjamin. That's what I call my box full of photos of Henry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why not call...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: God. We owned this flat together. Then one morning, just like that, he was gone. He ran off with the waitress at our favorite restaurant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's awful. What kind of restaurant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I couldn't afford the flat myself. So I sold it at a loss. Ah, but what's ten years of bliss down the drain  compared with the thrill of starting over with nothing and no one?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm so sorry. These must be very painful memories.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If it would help you to forget, I could hit you in the brain stem with this candlestick.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Thank you. No. Look, Jim, Dwight, please, don't tell anyone about this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no. Of course. Just one quick question. Was this um, Halloween, or...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: God, no. That's the most embarrassing thing of all this. What kind of fool gets her heart broken by bloody stage magician?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in the phone] You know what, Pam? I was thinking maybe we should change course here. Let's give up on all this mean stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? No! No, I just had this brilliant idea- everyone loved it. You don't have a copyright on pranks. I might be better at this than you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that's not what I-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Jim, could you give us a hand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely. Yeah. [whispers] Call it off, Pam. Call it off, okay? It's way more complicated than you think. Cancel the magician. Trust me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay. Okay, I will. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pam, we have a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Listen to this.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We're going to have the fluorescent lights flickering. It's gonna make everyone sick.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Or what if...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We discuss... [Angela and Phyllis giggle] the idea of doing the party totally normal. Like, not mean. Just a regular party. [giggling stops] Not mean.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I knew she'd crack! I wanted to leave you out, you know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We're in far too deep. We can't change course at this point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you talking about? Yes we can.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What I mean to say is we don't want to.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Toots, we're not stopping this train, so get off the tracks.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: [pops balloon] Suck it! [cheers, applause]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It'll be fine. Just act natural. Do you want a gummy penis?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, uh, I'll just have some gummy bears.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: These are delicious.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But... they're penises.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: And we come to Matthew. The guy who was with his old girlfriend basically the whole time we were together. [party guests groan]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ew! Aww! That seems gross at first blush, right? But relationships are always more complicated than you think. I mean, we don't know Matthew's history with this other woman. Maybe she saved his life. [laughs] I don't know.  I just- I don't think we should rush to judgment about Matthew. Maybe we don't pop that one.

quotes.speaker: Party guests
quotes.text: No, pop it. Pop it! [Lauren pops the balloon, party guests cheer]

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Sorry. It's kind of a madhouse.

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: [grabs Andy] Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh! Ah, Megan.

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: You are one of the good ones, nard dog.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Aww.

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: No, really. [to Jessica] Where's my Andy?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: I dunno.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, he's out there.

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: Aww. Are you going to sing for us?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, you guys are doing a pretty good job with the scary yelling, so...

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: That's not like you. That's not like you. Come on, sing! Sing!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] By yon bonnie banks and by yon bonnie braes...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, they're almost here- What? Come on. If you guys are gonna be mean, could you at least be subtle? [rips down ugly photo of Nellie]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, in the warehouse we use code names for people we want to talk about. Andy was Jelly Roll. Mike was Dennis the Menace. Ryan was douche bag.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, that's not a code name. That's just an insult.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Plus everyone would know who you meant.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, that's a great idea. Let's have a code name. How about Mondays? I hate Mondays? Mondays are the worst?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nobody's named Monday.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, how about we go with Pam? Simple, easy to remember.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 'Cause there's someone already here named Pam.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Shh, here she comes!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Welcome to your party.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Everybody get comfy now. This first song's over a half hour long. [plays off-tune notes]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Best gig ever. They asked me to play only originals. I said, "Have you heard my originals? They're terrible." They said, "Even better." I said, "I get it. It's an ironic party for Nellie."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Maybe we should just go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. I gotta do this. Hey Jessica, could I talk to you?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, sure. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, maybe we could talk in private?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. What is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, first just let me say that I hope when I'm done with the sort of ugly bits that we can stay friends.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: You're breaking up with me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, no. No. You always do this. You twist my words around. Part of me thinks we should just end this right now.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh my God. Are you leaving me for Erin? You said she wasn't relationship material and she wasn't as good as me, but it's her, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa! That? No. Okay. You want honesty? Super-honesty time. I'm gay.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am gay, and I prefer men.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: I knew it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You did not, Kenny!

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: You invited me to go shopping with you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I like hanging out with you. You're a cool guy. Which proves my point. That I'm gay.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Andy, you're not gay. I mean, we were... together. And you seemed pretty excitable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I was faking it. I had to fake it every time. I had to imagine that I was in a steam room with John Stamos.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: I can't say it doesn't make sense...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well... I mean, I was good at hiding it, but-

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Look, it's fine, Andy. I didn't think we were gonna get married or anything. I just... I'm just upset for now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Understandable. And I'm really sorry. I really am. [hugs Jessica, grunts] So... we should probably... go.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: This humble but sincere effort is all for our valued new colleague. Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: To Nellie Bertram, you are a most welcome and friendly presence at our company.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Why thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, on the other hand, is a most unwelcome, entitled, unfriendly presence in our company.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nellie is terrific, but to be honest, every day I imagine how happy I'd be if Pam died. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Well. I feel that as someone who knows Pam only a little bit... enough. A good amount. Not the most, though. I would say that she is misunderstood and that maybe there's some stuff in her past that you guys don't know about that's a little messed up and probably makes her such a torture to work with.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: We hate Pam. We hate Pam.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: We hate Pam! We hate Pam!

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: So we've established-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. No.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: -that you guys hate Pam. Do you ever wish she would just... disappear? [sets off flash paper]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! [laughter, murmuring]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That was a really rough scene.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right? Rough scene.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh... at least we can kiss now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. [gives him a quick kiss]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, that stuff that I said about you to her... I did- That's just- I had to say it. You know, I was dating her at the time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. Yes, of course. Ah... I feel really tired.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Probably from seeing that turkey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: When we drove by the farm. Oh. Always does it.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: Are you Nellie? Oh, I think you're my volunteer. Come on over here, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I'll do it. I will volunteer.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: no, Nellie, she-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: Oh! Big guy, huh? How's the air up there? Watch out for... birds. [chuckles] All right, let's uh- let's do some card magic. Now, what I want you to do is... I want you to pick a card just by looking at it. Do not say what it is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [picks a card] It's the four of hearts.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh, no, you-

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: Looks like we got a guy from another country here, huh? No hablo el cardo, senor? Hmm? Ha. All right, the card is picked. Now sir, will you please shuffled the deck? [Jim drops the cards] You didn't just do that on purpose, did ya?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Why is Jim treating the magician poorly?

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: Little known fact about me. Before I was a magician, I used to work at a rope factory.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not true. 'Cause that's not a real place.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: But I never could seem to figure out those knots.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's not a real knot. When you pull on it, it disappears.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: [yells] What the hell? All right, where's Phyllis? Who's Phyllis? Look. This is really uncool, okay? I put on a clean show here-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay scram, wizard.

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You heard me!

quotes.speaker: Magician
quotes.text: Huh!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well Nellie, I'm sorry. If I'd known Jim and Pam would use this party as an excuse to abuse a magician-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, I thought it was quite fun. In fact, I think they're brilliant employees, in their own way. Don't you see what I see?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Interesting. Yes. No, yes, I see that. Great work, team. Great party.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You think this is a great party? This cake has vegetables in it. Like a salad bar, Robert. How do I get this taste out of my mouth?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What? Why are we-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just gotta do one thing. [leaves car, knocks on door]

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: Oh. Hello. Hey everybody, look who's here.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi. Super-duper honesty time. I'm not gay. In fact, I'm so not gay, I'm in love with a girl. Her name is Erin Hannon and she's right there. She's sweet, funny and beautiful and total relationship material.

quotes.speaker: Megan
quotes.text: Why the hell did you come back here?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Go away.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: Get lost!

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Get out!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: You're done!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bye guys.

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: Get out! You ruined my party! Who does that? Are you kidding me? [Andy and Erin run to the car] Yeah, run away!

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: You're disgusting!

quotes.speaker: Lauren
quotes.text: I can't believe you're not gay! [Andy and Erin kiss]

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: Yeah get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Lauren's Friends
quotes.text: Don't come back. [someone throws food at the car]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh-oh! [laughs, they drive away]

quotes.speaker: Lauren's Friends
quotes.text: You don't even know how to drive! Bye Andy! Loser! Nice car!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Hank.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Yes ma'am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I thought I was very specific about you not letting up a magician.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Yes ma'am. I got my eyes open.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, turns out he actually made it up there.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: What? That ain't right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he came and went.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Wait a minute! You said it was a magician, right? [Pam nods] You don't think he could've used... it couldn't have been...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let's just- let's go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Night-night.
